newsitem.title: USA: St. Petersburg, Fla., mulls museum bail-out bonds.
newsitem.headline: St. Petersburg, Fla., mulls museum bail-out bonds.

text.p: Florida's St. Petersburg City Council is considering a $5.5 million bond issue to bail out the struggling Florida International Museum, the St. Petersburg Times reported Wednesday.
The city previously guaranteed the downtown museum's $1.5 million loan from Barnett Banks Inc, which carries an 8.25 percent interest rate.
The city council also voted in January to directly loan the museum another $3.9 million to keep it afloat long enough to get through a much-anticipated exhibit of relics from the Titanic in November.
The latest proposal would instead finance all the debt with a variable-rate, tax-exempt revenue bond issue to be repaid with museum receipts. The plan was scheduled for a public hearing next week.
If the nonprofit museum does not raise enough revenues to repay the debt, the city would assume ownership of its building and parkage garage valued at $3.5 million.
